title: Jamf Connect Monitor Configuration
description: Enterprise security monitoring settings for Jamf Connect privilege elevation detection and automated admin account remediation.

NotificationSettings.title: üì¢ Notification Settings
NotificationSettings.description: Configure how security violations are reported

WebhookURL.title: Slack/Teams Webhook URL
WebhookURL.description: Complete webhook URL for real-time security alerts

options.infoText: Example: https://hooks.slack.com/services/T00000000/B00000000/XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX

EmailRecipient.title: Security Team Email
EmailRecipient.description: Email address for violation reports and alerts

options.infoText: Example: security@yourcompany.com

SMTPServer.title: SMTP Server (Required for Email)
SMTPServer.description: SMTP server required for email delivery - system mail no longer supported

options.infoText: Examples: smtp.gmail.com, smtp.office365.com, or your corporate SMTP server. REQUIRED for email notifications in v2.2.0+
Common ports: 465 (SSL - recommended for Gmail/Google Workspace), 587 (TLS/STARTTLS), 25 (unencrypted - not recommended). Use 465 if port 587 is blocked.

SMTPUsername.title: SMTP Username
SMTPUsername.description: Email account username for SMTP authentication

options.infoText: Usually your full email address (e.g., alerts@yourcompany.com or personal.account@gmail.com)

SMTPPassword.title: SMTP Password
SMTPPassword.description: Email account password or app-specific password

options.infoText: For Gmail: Create App Password in Google Account settings. For Office365: Use account password or create app password.

SMTPFromAddress.title: From Email Address (Optional)
SMTPFromAddress.description: Email address shown as sender in violation notifications

options.infoText: Leave blank to use SMTP username as sender address. Can be different for branded emails.
Detailed includes hostname, user, timing. Security Report includes full system context.

NotificationCooldownMinutes.title: Notification Cooldown (Minutes)
NotificationCooldownMinutes.description: Prevent spam by limiting notification frequency per device

options.infoText: Prevents notification spam during repeated violations

MonitoringMode.title: Monitoring Mode
MonitoringMode.description: Choose between periodic checks or real-time monitoring

options.infoText: Real-time provides immediate detection but uses more resources
When enabled, unauthorized admin accounts are immediately demoted

GracePeriodMinutes.title: Grace Period (Minutes)
GracePeriodMinutes.description: Wait time before removing admin privileges

options.infoText: Allows brief admin access for legitimate elevation before removal

MonitorJamfConnectOnly.title: Monitor Jamf Connect Events Only
MonitorJamfConnectOnly.description: Only monitor elevations through Jamf Connect, ignore manual admin changes

options.infoText: Recommended: Focus on Jamf Connect elevation violations only

RequireConfirmation.title: Require Confirmation Before Removal
RequireConfirmation.description: Prompt before removing admin privileges (disables auto-remediation)

options.infoText: Only enable for testing - disables automatic security response

ViolationReporting.title: Enable Violation Reporting
ViolationReporting.description: Create detailed logs and reports for security violations

LogRetentionDays.title: Log Retention (Days)
LogRetentionDays.description: How long to keep monitoring and violation logs

options.infoText: Longer retention helpful for security audits and compliance

ExcludeSystemAccounts.title: Excluded System Accounts
ExcludeSystemAccounts.description: System accounts to ignore during monitoring

options.infoText: Default exclusions prevent false alerts for system accounts

JamfProIntegration.title: ‚òÅÔ∏è Jamf Pro Integration
JamfProIntegration.description: Configure integration with Jamf Pro services

UpdateInventoryOnViolation.title: Update Inventory on Violations
UpdateInventoryOnViolation.description: Automatically update Jamf Pro inventory when violations occur

options.infoText: Ensures Extension Attributes reflect current violation status

TriggerPolicyOnViolation.title: Policy Trigger for Violations
TriggerPolicyOnViolation.description: Custom trigger to execute additional policies during violations

options.infoText: Example: security_incident_response

CompanyName.title: Company Name
CompanyName.description: Organization name for branding in reports and notifications

options.infoText: Appears in security reports and notification messages

ITContactEmail.title: IT Support Email
ITContactEmail.description: IT contact information for user notifications

options.infoText: Included in user-facing security messages

DebugLogging.title: Enable Debug Logging
DebugLogging.description: Verbose logging for troubleshooting (increases log size)

options.infoText: Only enable during troubleshooting - significantly increases log volume

MonitoringInterval.title: Periodic Check Interval (Seconds)
MonitoringInterval.description: How often to check for violations in periodic mode

options.infoText: Only applies when Monitoring Mode is Periodic or Hybrid

MaxNotificationsPerHour.title: Max Notifications Per Hour
MaxNotificationsPerHour.description: Rate limit to prevent notification flooding

options.infoText: Prevents overwhelming security team during major incidents

AutoPopulateApprovedAdmins.title: Auto-populate Approved Admin List
AutoPopulateApprovedAdmins.description: Automatically create approved admin list from current administrators during installation

options.infoText: Recommended: Creates baseline from current admin accounts
